sections.title: Video
sections.content: See Intel Graphics and Hardware Acceleration

sections.title: Audio
sections.content:
If the Headphone Jack Audio not working it can be fixed by create the following file:

```
/etc/modprobe.d/headphonejack.conf
```

```
options snd_hda_intel model=headset-mode-no-hp-mic
```

sections.title: Function keys
sections.content:
The most Fn function keys work out of the box. For the Fn function keys F10, F11 and F12 the following must be set as kernel parameter. If tuxedo-drivers-dkmsAUR is installed this is not necessary.

```
acpi_os_name=Linux acpi_osi=
```

sections.title: TUXEDO Control Center
sections.content: See TUXEDO InfinityBook Pro 15v4#TUXEDO Control Center.

sections.title: Suspend
sections.content:
See Power management/Suspend and hibernate#Changing suspend method.

Read more at the help page from TUXEDO: https://www.tuxedocomputers.com/en/Infos/Help-Support/Instructions/Fine-tuning-of-power-management-with-suspend-standby.tuxedo.

sections.title: Undervolting
sections.content:
Note: **may** 

With the TUXEDO Premium BIOS you can undervolt the CPU over the BIOS. You can switch between -10mV and -100mV. The selectable values are not dangerous, but test it in small steps. So try -60mV, if it is stable you can try -70mV and so on You also can use intel-undervolt. Read Undervolting CPU for more Informations. As default -0mV is pre-selected. You can change the value over the BIOS under Setup Utility > Advanced > Advanced Chipset Control > BIOS-controlled Undervolting.

sections.title: BIOS Performance Profiles
sections.content:
With the TUXEDO Premium BIOS you can select one of four Performance Profiles. As default the Entertainment is pre-selected.

- Quiet
- Power Saving
- Entertainment
- Performance

You can change the Profile over the BIOS under Setup Utility > Advanced > Advanced Chipset Control > Performance Profile Select. More informations can found at the help page from TUXEDO [1]
